alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 29 at 5:58AM ChST until October 30 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CHST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 15 feet in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet in the surf zone. There will be a high risk of rip currents. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...The High Surf Warning is in effect through 6 AM Sunday. The High Surf Advisory is in effect from 6 AM Sunday to 6 PM Sunday. There is a high risk of rip currents through Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A large, long period north swell with create hazardous to dangerous surf along north facing reefs through Sunday afternoon. Dangerous rip currents are likely.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
